__e: There aren't enough staff to cope...
We don't have enough time. We don't have enough manpower. Money.
The kids are asleep. The nurse and maid are out, my husband's at the theatre.
I reminded her how hard it is - to find properly trained staff now.
Perhaps after all we'll be able to find a place for them on our staff.
It seems you could've had your staff - bring them down to my house.
My wife will be at her club function, and it's the staff's night off.
And of course he was discharged prematurely and forgot taking his pills.
None of the regular staff sees the other one.
So, here he is, personal trainer by trade, if you can call that a trade, makes 30 grand a year, if he's lucky, stops working altogether when he marries Evelyn.
Mmm... All right, kid, to make this right, I'm gonna hook you up with my personal trainer.
But it looks like he sees a personal trainer, though.
If Jack Neil cannot protect the workers under his own roof--
Go if you want, but leave the employees alone.
Driving my staff crazy, wanting everything to be perfect for the party tonight.
God, you are lucky I gave the staff the holiday off.

The servants are all absent the first eight days.
